newsitem.title: LATVIA: Latvian shares mixed, market waits for H1 results.
newsitem.headline: Latvian shares mixed, market waits for H1 results.

text.p: Latvian shares were mixed in slow trade on Monday and dealers said they hoped that six-month company results, due in July, would inject life into the sluggish market.
Total turnover came to 61,000 lats compared to Friday's 83,000. The bourse index closed 0.41 points or 0.11 percent up at 383.62.
The Rietumu index slipped 0.59 percent to 152.63.
Dealers said they expected the market to respond favourably to a spate of company results due out soon.
"Six-month results will be released in July and for many bigger stocks expectations are pretty upbeat," Karlis Krastinsh, head of the securities department with Saules Bank, told Reuters.
On the official list, Staburadze confectionery rose one santime to 2.72 lats as it saw volume of 3,800 lats. Unibanka added three santimes to 3.38 lats in trade of 20,700 lats.
Riga Shipyard and the Riga Transport Fleet lost ground. Shipyard registered trade of 9,000 lats as it lost two santimes to 1.30 lats.
Fleet closed two santimes lower at 1.15 lats on volume of 3,600 lats.
Olainfarm, a pharmaceutical company on the secondary list, plummeted to 2.17 lats from 2.55 lats, turning over 4,800 lats.
The company, which made its bourse debut a few weeks ago, has bounced up and down and dealers remain divided over its value.
